page.title: 04The Red Lion - Todwick.
page.content: This{restaurant}on Kiveton Lane in Todwick used to be across the road from where it is now, and was built in 1923. Before that time the building was a private house with stables.In 1933 the house was made into a restaurant and later the stables were made into a pub to improve it. The menu is both a la carte, prepared and cooked to order, and the table d'hote set menu. Prices vary between Â£5.95 and Â£8.75. During the third week in May they ordered 11 gallons of beer and the same in lager. The restaurant is most busy on Saturday nights and Sunday lunch time.In 1986 40 bedrooms will be built on and the restaurant will be made into an{hotel}to cater for passing trade on the A57 or the motorway, as well as visitors to the nearby towns.
